events.name: Energy Infrastructure Cyber Security Workshop
events.description: Advanced Digital Sciences Center (ADSC) would like to cordially invite you to Energy Infrastructure Cyber Security (EICS) Workshop on 25 May (Wednesday) 2016. EICS workshop focuses on cyber security research for power grids and energy infrastructure, with the goal to foster collaboration in this important area between academia and industry, and between overseas and Singapore-based researchers and practitioners. The workshop will include multiple invited talks and panel discussions, accompanied by demos and presentations of the latest outcomes from several research projects in this area. ADSC is a research center of University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, established in 2009 with core funding from Singapore’s Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR).
events.location: 138634, 2 Fusionopolis Way, Innovis, Meeting Room – “Multi-Purpose Hall”(on the ground floor), Singapore 138634

events.name: IoT Security in Today’s World
events.description: The Internet of Things (IoT) has rapidly evolved and expanded to encompass everything from consumer devices like watches, thermostats, and automobiles, to vast critical infrastructure like healthcare systems, power grids, and nuclear plants. Every component, device, and system that relies on software is a part of an interconnected cyber supply chain that we have become increasingly dependent on – and every link in that chain is an attack vector through which an adversary could potentially cause harm, often with rippling effects.   Modern software development practices dominated by component-based engineering and short development cycles have largely been a catalyst for rapid advancements in technology. These practices, however, have also resulted in an epidemic of known vulnerabilities baked into third-party software components of IoT applications and devices. These widespread security flaws, many of which are critical in nature, often remain unnoticed or unaddressed throughout the software or device lifecycle, posing significant risks to the people and organizations that rely on them.   During this presentation, Synopsis will share about the problem of an ever changing threat landscape, which Synopsys can address today by its best in class solutions from Static Code Analysis, Supply Chain Management to Fuzzing. Included in the seminar is a free binary scan using the Protecode SC application composition analysis scanner. You can bring any binaries that you are working on (refer to this page for more information).   Agenda    3:00pm - 3:30pm Overview of Synopsys SIG products 3:30pm – 4:00pm Static code analysis with Code Advisor and Test Advisor 4:00pm - 4:30pm IoT security in today’s world (Defensics) 4:30pm – 5:00pm Binary scanning and software composition analysis (Protecode SC)   About the speakers  Darence Tan is a Regional Sales Manager with Synopsys Singapore.  He oversees the South Asia region, namely Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam, Australia, New Zealand, Pakistan etc.  He has been with Synopsys for over 17 years.  He is actively involved in the business development and manpower development programs in South Asia working with various multi-national companies, government organizations, universities, research institutes and startups. Before joining Synopsys, Darence has worked with Cadence and Mentor Graphics, which encompassed various roles of responsibility such as applications support, technical marketing, consulting and design services.   Olli Jarva is senior sales engineering manager with Synopsys Singapore. Prior to his current post, he worked for the company developing intelligent fuzzing solutions for testing communication interfaces. Mr. Jarva is an expert in network protocol security and he has a deep understanding of protocol vulnerabilities. Mr. Jarva's professional background is in system administration and risk coordination. He has been involved in the discovery and coordination of a number of zero-day vulnerabilities, including the IPv6 Jumbodiagram and Linux SCTP stack vulnerabilities. Mr. Jarva is a regular speaker at various security testing conferences such as RSA, AusCert, CodeGate

events.name: DevSecOps Singapore May Meetup
events.description:
** DevSecOps Singapore is free for anyone to attend there is no charge for meetup** • Networking: 15 Mins  • A Snapshot of Current Digital Trends by Amelia Ching • DevSecOps from Corporate internal auditor perspective by Peixin : 30 mins • Open House session by Stefan & Suman: 15 mins Abstract :  A Snapshot of Current Digital Trends This session aims to share the strategic technology trends and predictions by established research firms and the extent of technologies’ adoption prevalent in the various industries.  Gain quick awareness and insights into the emerging technologies and their potential impact on businesses.  Find out also what are some in-demand competencies and skills our people should be equipped with and what are some programme offerings available to get them up the digital curve DevSecOps from Corporate internal auditor perspective DevSecOps means unavoidably crossing paths with an auditor at some point especially where the product is made for highly regulated business environments - Compliance can become a heart-wrenching hurdle to real progress. Is there real conflict or are opportunities for collaboration still waiting to be discovered?This will be a short presentation followed by an open discussion for everyone standing on both sides of the compliance wall. Speakers Bio :  Amelia Ching is the Academic Director at the Financial IT Academy @SMU. She has extensive experience in technology management for corporate banking applications having spent more than 25 years at Citi. She is particularly well versed in Project Management, IT Service Management, Risks and Control, Program Management Office, Internet Operational Readiness and implementation process and IT Outsourcing Service Management. Her last held position was Risks and Control and PMO Head for the Treasury and Trade Solutions Technology Group, Asia Pacific. 


PeiXin is highly experienced in standards and compliance,she has lead auditor qualifications for business continuity, information security and quality management, trained in ITILv3 foundation , she is certified scrum master (CSM), BCM manager (CITBCM) . She is an advocate for the DevOps movement who used to implement and audit ISO standards for information security, business continuity and quality management over the past 10 years in traditional business environments. Now she focuses on integrating these fields of practice into DevSecOps.
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Information Systems, Level 3, Seminar Rm 3-1, 80 Stamford Road, Singapore 178902

events.name: Introduction to Meucci's "The Checklist" with Python Code Examples
events.description: Hello everyone, Our next talk will be a cross-over talk on Python, on Portfolio Management. Peter Chan, who also uses a fair bit of R, will be giving the talk. He will be giving an introduction to Meucci's "The Checklist" - Ten Steps for Advanced Risk and Portfolio Management. In order to make it more concrete, he will also be sharing code examples in Python. Looking forward to seeing you at the event. You can download Attilio Meucci's "The Checklist" (formerly known as "The Prayer") from http://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=1753788 The 10 steps are: • Quest for Invariance • Estimation • Projection • Pricing • Aggregation • Attribution • Evaluation • Optimization • Execution • Ex-post Performance Analysis
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

Space Sponsor The Co.   The Co. is a revolutionary co-working and premium shared workspace concept created to support the new way we work today. events.name: Ethereum Singapore: "Blockchain Insights" in partnership with NUS Enterprise
events.description: Hello fellow Etherians, We have put together another seminar, hosted by a former web developer from Ethcore, Chris Hitchott.  Having had the experience to work former Ethereum co-founders, such as Dr Gavin Wood, Chris comes with great knowledge on the forefront and challenges on working with Ethereum. Chris will be giving a thematic talk on "where blockchain is going" from his personal perspective as well as highlighting industry-related headlines and developments.  Chris Hitchott has an academic background in digital design and over a decade of experience designing and building many kinds of web applications. He had previously lived in Hong Kong for the last 3 years working on his event app start-up TAPevents. He recently joined DigixGlobal as a DApp developer.  This event is sponsored by NUS Enterprise.  NUS Enterprise (ETP) provides an entrepreneurial and innovative dimension to the University's core research and educational activities. By igniting the entrepreneurial spirit, partnering for success and nurturing future entrepreneurial leaders, NUS Enterprise aims to make a positive impact on Singapore's economy and beyond. This is done through three key thrusts: Entrepreneurship Support Experiential Education and Industry Engagement & Partnerships. http://www2.blk71.com/ Shoutout to a fellow contributor on Ethereum Singapore meetup group, Gaurang Torvekar, a very helpful Etherian who is also a co-organizer of this event.  Please do join our growing Ethereum SG Slack Chat here at, https://ethereumsg.slack.com/signup  See you all there, Shaun Djie  Head Ethereum Singapore Organizer Gaurang Torvekar Event Co-organizer
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Hyunju Lee (Julee)
events.description: Hello all! We're honoured to have our 2nd design leader for this series of meetup and she is none other than Hyunju Lee (Julee), Head of User Experience Design at honestbee. (Did anyone guess that grocery hint correctly?)  About JuleeWith 12 years of experience in diverse industries all across the globe, Julee has led teams to deliver world-class products that consider customer experiences via multiple touch points. Her extensive design skills that bridge various disciplines, along with her keen customer empathy, have been vital in redefining user experiences for renowned clients such as PayPal, Intuit, Cisco, Yahoo! and Samsung. Driven by her sense of innovation, her portfolio has delighted millions of users and includes 11 patents with the USPTO. --- Agenda for the night7pm – 7.30pm: Registration and networking 7.30pm – 8.30pm: Conversation with Julee8.30pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at kiat@ixda.sg and I'll ask them on your behalf :) Alternatively, feel free to tweet us the questions to @IxDASG and we can have that answered! Update: Thanks to Zendesk Singapore and Jian Wei, we got a venue at their office :)
events.location: Zendesk Singapore, 401 Commonwealth Drive Haw Par Technocentre, #07-01

events.name: Hackware v1.8
events.description:
Hi guys, we need to collect your particulars for the security at Google so they'll allow you in. Please register yourself through this link: http://goo.gl/forms/WBlNNgBZ8ePlease do this in advanced. See you at Hackware in a couple of weeks! 



Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on. Talks for this meetup: 1. (20min) IoT Smart Shelf - Leon Lim2. (20min) FPGA 102 - Brahim Hamadicharef3. (10min) Demo of open source FPGA too chain - Michał J. Gajda4. (20min) Gaming Console for Kids - Gabriel J Perumal 5. Announcements by anyone on:- Hiring positions- Available for hire- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else 6. Show and Tell Talks : ~20minsTalks typically include side projects of speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things and much more. We want to hear about an electronics project that you already implemented at home or anywhere. Lightning Talks : ~5minsLightning talks are short electronics demo that are working or even incomplete based on open source hardware and software. We wanna see all your fried chips and electronics to be fixed. Nothing has to be perfect - we are all learning. Bring them!(No product videos or proprietery technology.) Announcements: ~1minAnnouncement can be done by anyone looking to get hired or hire someone. Talk about your project / company and tell us who you are looking for. Show and Tell: ~free and easyBring your completed / uncompleted hardware projects and ask for feedback and share your learnings. Venue host for this meetup is ♥ Google Singapore ♥ Please indicate that you will be "Going" for this meetup because badges will need to be printed etc.
events.location: Gotham, Google Singapore, Floor 31, 8 Marina View, Asia Square 1 #30-01, Singapore 018960
